ilo: Design achievable Mathematics lesson and unit plans, integrating knowledge of student learning, curriculum, assessment, and reporting.

Demonstrate strong Mathematics subject and pedagogical content knowledge, including differentiation of teaching and content selection and organisation, to meet the specific needs of students of diverse backgrounds and abilities, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander students.

Select and integrate Mathematics strategies and resources, including literacy and numeracy understandings, and the effective and appropriate use of ICT, to meet the specific needs of students from diverse backgrounds, and to engage students in their learning.
Identify and evaluate assessment and diagnostic strategies in Mathematics, including moderation, to assess, support and provide evidence of learning for students across the full range of abilities.
generic_skills: Responsiveness to a changing knowledge base.

Prerequisites.content: Teacher Candidates that commenced prior to 2022 may have completed EDUC90457 Learning Area Mathematics 1

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Report: Report on assessment in Mathematics

assessment.hurdle: A minimum of 80% attendance at, or engagement with, all sessions identified as contact hours (may include lectures, tutorials, seminars and workshops, both synchronous and asynchronous).
